availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Leuba (Clark/ Kenton/ Harrison County, schoolteacher and bookkeeper)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, schoolteacher and bookkeeper. Native of France. Married to Catherine Leuba. Father of George Leuba, and Charles Leuba. Schoolteacher in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Clark County in 1850. Bookkeeper in Covington in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 45A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 309.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 3, p. 614.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Berryville, p. 91A.
